Class Vehicle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Vehicle

  • public class Vehicle
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that provides the template for the Vehicle object
    Author:
    sriram

      Backoff counter.

      Class variable; counter variable

      Vehicle ID
      (package private) int pkt_id
      ID of packet being received currently
      (package private) java.util.Queue<Packet> pktqueue
      Packet queue of the vehicle
      (package private) float pos_x
      Vehicle position (X coordinate)
      (package private) float pos_y
      Vehicle position (Y coordinate)
      (package private) int recv_tx
      Time left to finish receiving packet.
      (package private) int segment_x
      Vehicle position in terms of segments (X coordinate)
      (package private) int segment_y
      Vehicle position in terms of segments (Y coordinate)
      (package private) boolean tx
      True if vehicle is currently transmitting
      (package private) int tx_id
      ID of vehicle from which this vehicle is currently receiving (V2V)
      (package private) double velocity
      Velocity of the vehicle
      (package private) int x_dxn
      Motion is L to R (+1) or R to L (-1)
      (package private) int y_dxn
      Motion is T to B (+1) or B to T (-1)

        java.util.Queue<Packet> pktqueue
        Packet queue of the vehicle

      • backoff

        int backoff
        Backoff counter. Samples from a contention window of size min_cw to max_cw

      • recv_tx

        int recv_tx
        Time left to finish receiving packet. Packet reception is ongoing.

      • counter

        private static int counter
        Class variable; counter variable

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vehicle

        Vehicle(double velocity,
       int x_dxn,
       int y_dxn,
       float pos_x,
       float pos_y)
        Public class constructor for a new vehicle object. Takes some parameters, sets other variables by itself.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The initial velocity of the vehicle
        x_dxn - whether motion is from L to R or vice versa
        y_dxn - whether motion is from T to B or vice versa
        pos_x - X coordinate of vehicle
        pos_y - Y coordinate of vehicle

    • Method Detail

      • checkTimer

        public boolean checkTimer()
        A timer that samples from an exponential distribution and counts down to zero, upon which it resets. Used to time velocity changes for vehicles.
        Returns:
        A boolean that tells if the counter has reached zero or not.

      • resetCounter

        public static void resetCounter()
        Public static method to reset the unique vehicle ID generator.
